name: Master-ball
effect: Catches a wild Pokémon every time.

name: Ultra-ball
effect: Tries to catch a wild Pokémon.  Success rate is 2×.

name: Great-ball
effect: Tries to catch a wild Pokémon.  Success rate is 1.5×.

name: Poke-ball
effect: Tries to catch a wild Pokémon.

name: Safari-ball
effect: Tries to catch a wild Pokémon in the Great Marsh or Safari Zone.  Success rate is 1.5×.

name: Net-ball
effect: Tries to catch a wild Pokémon.  Success rate is 3× for water and bug Pokémon.

name: Dive-ball
effect: Tries to catch a wild Pokémon. Success rate is 3.5× when underwater, fishing, or surfing.

name: Nest-ball
effect: Tries to catch a wild Pokémon.  Success rate is 3.9× for level 1 Pokémon, and drops steadily to 1× at level 30.

name: Repeat-ball
effect: Tries to catch a wild Pokémon.  Success rate is 3× for previously-caught Pokémon.

name: Timer-ball
effect: Tries to catch a wild Pokémon. Success rate increases by 0.1× (Gen V: 0.3×) every turn, to a max of 4×.

name: Luxury-ball
effect: Tries to catch a wild Pokémon.  Caught Pokémon start with 200 happiness.

name: Premier-ball
effect: Tries to catch a wild Pokémon.

name: Dusk-ball
effect: Tries to catch a wild Pokémon.  Success rate is 3.5× at night and in caves.

name: Heal-ball
effect: Tries to catch a wild Pokémon.  Caught Pokémon are immediately healed.

name: Quick-ball
effect: Tries to catch a wild Pokémon. Success rate is 4× (Gen V: 5×), but only on the first turn.

name: Cherish-ball
effect: Tries to catch a wild Pokémon.

name: Potion
effect: Restores 20 HP.

name: Antidote
effect: Cures poison.

name: Burn-heal
effect: Cures a burn.

name: Ice-heal
effect: Cures freezing.

name: Awakening
effect: Cures sleep.

name: Paralyze-heal
effect: Cures paralysis.

name: Full-restore
effect: Restores HP to full and cures any status ailment and confusion.

name: Max-potion
effect: Restores HP to full.

name: Hyper-potion
effect: Restores 200 HP.

name: Super-potion
effect: Restores 50 HP.

name: Full-heal
effect: Cures any status ailment and confusion.

name: Revive
effect: Revives with half HP.

name: Max-revive
effect: Revives with full HP.

name: Fresh-water
effect: Restores 50 HP.

name: Soda-pop
effect: Restores 60 HP.

name: Lemonade
effect: Restores 80 HP.

name: Moomoo-milk
effect: Restores 100 HP.

name: Energy-powder
effect: Restores 50 HP, but lowers happiness.

name: Energy-root
effect: Restores 200 HP, but lowers happiness.

name: Heal-powder
effect: Cures any status ailment, but lowers happiness.

name: Revival-herb
effect: Revives with full HP, but lowers happiness.

name: Ether
effect: Restores 10 PP for one move.

name: Max-ether
effect: Restores PP to full for one move.

name: Elixir
effect: Restores 10 PP for each move.

name: Max-elixir
effect: Restores PP to full for each move.

name: Lava-cookie
effect: Cures any status ailment and confusion.

name: Berry-juice
effect: Restores 20 HP.

name: Sacred-ash
effect: Revives all fainted Pokémon with full HP.

name: Hp-up
effect: Raises HP effort and happiness.

name: Protein
effect: Raises Attack effort and happiness.

name: Iron
effect: Raises Defense effort and happiness.

name: Carbos
effect: Raises Speed effort and happiness.

name: Calcium
effect: Raises Special Attack effort and happiness.

name: Rare-candy
effect: Causes a level-up and raises happiness.

name: Pp-up
effect: Raises a move's max PP by 20%.

name: Zinc
effect: Raises Special Defense and happiness.

name: Pp-max
effect: Raises a move's max PP by 60%.

name: Old-gateau
effect: Cures any status ailment and confusion.

name: Guard-spec
effect: Prevents stat changes in battle for five turns in battle.  Raises happiness.

name: Dire-hit
effect: Increases the chance of a critical hit in battle.  Raises happiness.

name: X-attack
effect: Raises Attack by one stage in battle.  Raises happiness.

name: X-defense
effect: Raises Defense by one stage in battle.  Raises happiness.

name: X-speed
effect: Raises Speed by one stage in battle.  Raises happiness.

name: X-accuracy
effect: Raises accuracy by one stage in battle.  Raises happiness.

name: X-sp-atk
effect: Raises Special Attack by one stage in battle.  Raises happiness.

name: X-sp-def
effect: Raises Special Defense by one stage in battle.  Raises happiness.

name: Poke-doll
effect: Ends a wild battle.

name: Fluffy-tail
effect: Ends a wild battle.

name: Blue-flute
effect: Cures sleep.

name: Yellow-flute
effect: Cures confusion.

name: Red-flute
effect: Cures attraction.

name: Black-flute
effect: Halves the wild Pokémon encounter rate.

name: White-flute
effect: Doubles the wild Pokémon encounter rate.

name: Shoal-salt
effect: No effect. Gen III: Trade four and four Shoal Shells for a Shell Bell.

name: Shoal-shell
effect: No effect. Gen III: Trade four and four Shoal Salts for a Shell Bell.

name: Red-shard
effect: No effect. Can be traded for items or moves.

name: Blue-shard
effect: No effect. Can be traded for items or moves.

name: Yellow-shard
effect: No effect. Can be traded for items or moves.

name: Green-shard
effect: No effect. Can be traded for items or moves.

name: Super-repel
effect: For 200 steps, prevents wild encounters of level lower than your party's lead Pokémon.

name: Max-repel
effect: For 250 steps, prevents wild encounters of level lower than your party's lead Pokémon.

name: Escape-rope
effect: Transports user to the outside entrance of a cave.

name: Repel
effect: For 100 steps, prevents wild encounters of level lower than your party's lead Pokémon.

name: Sun-stone
effect: Evolves a Cottonee into Whimsicott, a Gloom into Bellossom, a Petilil into Lilligant, or a Sunkern into Sunflora.

name: Moon-stone
effect: Evolves a Clefairy into Clefable, a Jigglypuff into Wigglytuff, a Munna into Musharna, a Nidorina into Nidoqueen, a Nidorino into Nidoking, or a Skitty into Delcatty.

name: Fire-stone
effect: Evolves an Eevee into Flareon, a Growlithe into Arcanine, a Pansear into Simisear, or a Vulpix into Ninetales.

name: Thunder-stone
effect: Evolves an Eelektrik into Eelektross, an Eevee into Jolteon, or a Pikachu into Raichu.

name: Water-stone
effect: Evolves an Eevee into Vaporeon, a Lombre into Ludicolo, a Panpour into Simipour, a Poliwhirl into Poliwrath, a Shellder into Cloyster, or a Staryu into Starmie.

name: Leaf-stone
effect: Evolves an Exeggcute into Exeggutor, a Gloom into Vileplume, a Nuzleaf into Shiftry, a Pansage into Simisage, or a Weepinbell into Victreebel.

name: Tiny-mushroom
effect: Fire Red and Leaf Green: Trade two for prior Level-up moves. Sell for 250 Pokédollars, or to Hungry Maid for 500 Pokédollars.

name: Big-mushroom
effect: Fire Red and Leaf Green: Trade for prior Level-up moves. Sell for 2500 Pokédollars, or to Hungry Maid for 5000 Pokédollars.

name: Pearl
effect: Sell for 700 Pokédollars, or to Ore Collector for 1400 Pokédollars.

name: Big-pearl
effect: Sell for 3750 Pokédollars, or to Ore Collector for 7500 Pokédollars.

name: Stardust
effect: Sell for 1000 Pokédollars, or to Ore Collector for 2000 Pokédollars.

name: Star-piece
effect: Platinum: Trade for one of each color Shard. Black and White: Trade for PP Up. Sell for 4900 Pokédollars, or to Ore Collector for 9800 Pokédollars.

name: Nugget
effect: Sell for 5000 Pokédollars, or to Ore Collector for 10000 Pokédollars.

name: Heart-scale
effect: No effect. Can be traded for prior Level-up moves.

name: Growth-mulch
effect: Growing time of berries is reduced, but the soil dries out faster.

name: Damp-mulch
effect: Growing time of berries is increased, but the soil dries out slower.

name: Stable-mulch
effect: Berries stay on the plant for longer than their usual time.

name: Gooey-mulch
effect: Berries regrow from dead plants an increased number of times.

name: Root-fossil
effect: Can be revived into a Lileep.

name: Claw-fossil
effect: Can be revived into an Anorith.

name: Helix-fossil
effect: Can be revived into an Omanyte.

name: Dome-fossil
effect: Can be revived into a Kabuto.

name: Old-amber
effect: Can be revived into an Aerodactyl.

name: Armor-fossil
effect: Can be revived into a Shieldon.

name: Skull-fossil
effect: Can be revived into a Cranidos.

name: Rare-bone
effect: Sell for 5000 Pokédollars, or to Bone Man for 10000 Pokédollars.

name: Shiny-stone
effect: Evolves a Minccino into Cinccino, a Roselia into Roserade, or a Togetic into Togekiss.

name: Dusk-stone
effect: Evolves a Lampent into Chandelure, a Misdreavus into Mismagius, or a Murkrow into Honchkrow.

name: Dawn-stone
effect: Evolves a male Kirlia into Gallade or a female Snorunt into Froslass.

name: Oval-stone
effect: Level-up during Day on a Happiny: Holder evolves into Chansey.

name: Odd-keystone
effect: Use on the tower on Route 209 to encounter Spiritomb if you have at least 32 Underground greetings.

name: Adamant-orb
effect: Boosts the damage from Dialga's Dragon-type and Steel-type moves by 20%.

name: Lustrous-orb
effect: Boosts the damage from Palkia's Dragon-type and Water-type moves by 20%.

name: Bright-powder
effect: Held: Increases the holder's evasion by 1/9 (11 1/9%).

name: White-herb
effect: Held: Resets all lowered stats to normal at end of turn. Consumed after use.

name: Macho-brace
effect: Held: Holder gains double effort values from battles, but has halved Speed in battle.

name: Exp-share
effect: Held: Half the experience from a battle is split between Pokémon holding this item.

name: Quick-claw
effect: Held: Holder has a 3/16 (18.75%) chance to move first.

name: Soothe-bell
effect: Held: Doubles the happiness earned by the holder.

name: Mental-herb
effect: Held: Consumed to cure infatuation. Gen V: Also removes Taunt, Encore, Torment, Disable, and Cursed Body.

name: Choice-band
effect: Held: Increases Attack by 50%, but restricts the holder to only one move.

name: Kings-rock
effect: Held: Damaging moves gain a 10% chance to make their target flinch. Traded on a Poliwhirl: Holder evolves into Politoed. Traded on a Slowpoke: Holder evolves into Slowking.

name: Silver-powder
effect: Held: Bug-Type moves from holder do 20% more damage.

name: Amulet-coin
effect: Held: Doubles the money earned from a battle. Does not stack with Luck Incense.

name: Cleanse-tag
effect: Prevents wild encounters of level lower than your party's lead Pokémon.

name: Soul-dew
effect: Raises Latias and Latios's Special Attack and Special Defense by 50%.

name: Deep-sea-tooth
effect: Doubles Clamperl's Special Attack. Traded on a Clamperl: Holder evolves into Huntail.

name: Deep-sea-scale
effect: Doubles Clamperl's Special Defense. Traded on a Clamperl: Holder evolves into Gorebyss.

name: Smoke-ball
effect: Held: Allows the Holder to escape from any wild battle.

name: Everstone
effect: Held: Prevents level-based evolution from occuring.

name: Focus-band
effect: Held: Holder has 10% chance to survive attacks or self-inflicted damage at 1 HP.

name: Lucky-egg
effect: Held: Increases EXP earned in battle by 50%.

name: Scope-lens
effect: Held: Raises the holder's critical hit ratio by one stage.

name: Metal-coat
effect: Held: Steel-Type moves from holder do 20% more damage.

name: Leftovers
effect: Held: Restores 1/16 (6.25%) holder's max HP at the end of each turn.

name: Dragon-scale
effect: Traded on a Seadra: Holder evolves into Kingdra.

name: Light-ball
effect: Doubles Pikachu's Attack and Special Attack. Breed on Pikachu or Raichu: Pichu Egg will have Volt Tackle.

name: Soft-sand
effect: Held: Ground-Type moves from holder do 20% more damage.

name: Hard-stone
effect: Held: Rock-Type moves from holder do 20% more damage.

name: Miracle-seed
effect: Held: Grass-Type moves from holder do 20% more damage.

name: Black-glasses
effect: Held: Dark-Type moves from holder do 20% more damage.

name: Black-belt
effect: Held: Fighting-Type moves from holder do 20% more damage.

name: Magnet
effect: Held: Electric-Type moves from holder do 20% more damage.

name: Mystic-water
effect: Held: Water-Type moves from holder do 20% more damage.

name: Sharp-beak
effect: Held: Flying-Type moves from holder do 20% more damage.

name: Poison-barb
effect: Held: Poison-Type moves from holder do 20% more damage.

name: Never-melt-ice
effect: Held: Ice-Type moves from holder do 20% more damage.

name: Spell-tag
effect: Held: Ghost-Type moves from holder do 20% more damage.

name: Twisted-spoon
effect: Held: Psychic-Type moves from holder do 20% more damage.

name: Charcoal
effect: Held: Fire-Type moves from holder do 20% more damage.

name: Dragon-fang
effect: Held: Dragon-Type moves from holder do 20% more damage.

name: Silk-scarf
effect: Held: Normal-Type moves from holder do 20% more damage.

name: Up-grade
effect: Traded on a Porygon: Holder evolves into Porygon2.

name: Shell-bell
effect: Held: Holder receives 1/8 of the damage it deals when attacking.

name: Sea-incense
effect: Held: Water-Type moves from holder do 20% more damage. Breeding: Marill or Azumarill beget an Azurill Egg.

name: Lax-incense
effect: Held: Holder's evasion is increased by 5%. Breeding: Wobbuffet begets a Wynaut Egg.

name: Lucky-punch
effect: Raises Chansey's critical hit ratio by two stages.

name: Metal-powder
effect: Raises Ditto's Defense and Special Defense by 50%. The boost is lost after transforming.

name: Thick-club
effect: Doubles Cubone or Marowak's Attack.

name: Stick
effect: Raises Farfetch'd's critical hit ratio by two stages.

name: Red-scarf
effect: Raises the holder's Coolness while in a contest.

name: Blue-scarf
effect: Raises the holder's Beauty while in a contest.

name: Pink-scarf
effect: Raises the holder's Cuteness while in a contest.

name: Green-scarf
effect: Raises the holder's Smartness while in a contest.

name: Yellow-scarf
effect: Raises the holder's Toughness while in a contest.

name: Wide-lens
effect: Held: Provides a 1/10 (10%) boost in accuracy to the holder.

name: Muscle-band
effect: Held: Boosts the damage of physical moves used by the holder by 10%.

name: Wise-glasses
effect: Held: Boosts the damage of special moves used by the holder by 1/10 (10%).

name: Expert-belt
effect: Held: Holder's Super Effective moves do 20% extra damage.

name: Light-clay
effect: Held: Light Screen and Reflect used by the holder last 8 rounds instead of 5.

name: Life-orb
effect: Held: Holder's moves inflict 30% extra damage, but cost 10% max HP.

name: Power-herb
effect: Held: Both turns of a two-turn charge move happen at once. Consumed upon use.

name: Toxic-orb
effect: Held: Inflicts Toxic on the holder at the end of the turn. Activates after Poison damage would occur.

name: Flame-orb
effect: Held: Inflicts Burn on the holder at the end of the turn. Activates after Burn damage would occur.

name: Quick-powder
effect: Doubles Ditto's Speed when held. The boost is lost after transforming.

name: Focus-sash
effect: Held: Holder survives any single-hit attack at 1 HP if at max HP, then the item is consumed.

name: Zoom-lens
effect: Held: Provides a 1/5 (20%) boost in accuracy if the holder moves after the target.

name: Metronome
effect: Held: Consectutive uses of the same attack have a cumulative damage boost of 10%. Maximum 100% boost.

name: Iron-ball
effect: Held: Holder's Speed is halved. Negates all Ground-type immunities, and makes Flying-types take neutral damage from Ground-type moves. Arena Trap. Spikes, and Toxic Spikes affect the holder.

name: Lagging-tail
effect: Held: Holder moves last in its priority bracket.

name: Destiny-knot
effect: Held: Infatuates opposing Pokémon when holder is inflicted with infatuation.

name: Black-sludge
effect: Held: Poison-type holder recovers 1/16 (6.25%) max HP each turn. Non-Poison-Types take 1/8 (12.5%) max HP damage.

name: Icy-rock
effect: Held: Hail by the holder lasts 8 rounds instead of 5.

name: Smooth-rock
effect: Held: Sandstorm by the holder lasts 8 rounds instead of 5.

name: Heat-rock
effect: Held: Sunny Day by the holder lasts 8 rounds instead of 5.

name: Damp-rock
effect: Held: Rain Dance by the holder lasts 8 rounds instead of 5.

name: Grip-claw
effect: Held: Holder's multi-turn trapping moves last 5 turns.

name: Choice-scarf
effect: Held: Increases Speed by 50%, but restricts the holder to only one move.

name: Sticky-barb
effect: Held: Holder takes 1/8 (12.5%) its max HP at the end of each turn. When the holder is hit by a contact move, the attacking Pokémon takes 1/8 its max HP in damage and receive the item if not holding one.

name: Power-bracer
effect: Held: Holder gains 4 Attack effort values, but has halved Speed in battle.

name: Power-belt
effect: Held: Holder gains 4 Defense effort values, but has halved Speed in battle.

name: Power-lens
effect: Held: Holder gains 4 Special Attack effort values, but has halved Speed in battle.

effect: Held: Holder gains 4 Special Defense effort values, but has halved Speed in battle.

name: Power-anklet
effect: Held: Holder gains 4 Speed effort values, but has halved Speed in battle.

name: Power-weight
effect: Held: Holder gains 4 HP effort values, but has halved Speed in battle.

name: Shed-shell
effect: Held: Holder can bypass all trapping effects and switch out. Multi-turn moves still cannot be switched out of.

name: Big-root
effect: Held: Increases HP recovered from draining moves, Ingrain, and Aqua Ring by 3/10 (30%).

name: Choice-specs
effect: Held: Increases Special Attack by 50%, but restricts the holder to only one move.

name: Flame-plate
effect: Held: Fire-Type moves from holder do 20% more damage. Changes Arceus's and Judgment's type to Fire.

name: Splash-plate
effect: Held: Water-Type moves from holder do 20% more damage. Changes Arceus's and Judgment's type to Water.

name: Zap-plate
effect: Held: Electric-Type moves from holder do 20% more damage. Changes Arceus's and Judgment's type to Electric.

effect: Held: Grass-Type moves from holder do 20% more damage. Changes Arceus's and Judgment's type to Grass.

name: Icicle-plate
effect: Held: Ice-Type moves from holder do 20% more damage. Changes Arceus's and Judgment's type to Ice.

name: Toxic-plate

name: Earth-plate
effect: Held: Ground-Type moves from holder do 20% more damage. Changes Arceus's and Judgment's type to Ground.

name: Sky-plate
effect: Held: Flying-Type moves from holder do 20% more damage. Changes Arceus's and Judgment's type to Flying.

name: Mind-plate
effect: Held: Psychic-Type moves from holder do 20% more damage. Changes Arceus's and Judgment's type to Psychic.

name: Insect-plate
effect: Held: Bug-Type moves from holder do 20% more damage. Changes Arceus's and Judgment's type to Bug.

name: Stone-plate
effect: Held: Rock-Type moves from holder do 20% more damage. Changes Arceus's and Judgment's type to Rock.

name: Spooky-plate
effect: Held: Ghost-Type moves from holder do 20% more damage. Changes Arceus's and Judgment's type to Ghost.

name: Draco-plate
effect: Held: Dragon-Type moves from holder do 20% more damage. Changes Arceus's and Judgment's type to Dragon.

name: Dread-plate
effect: Held: Dark-Type moves from holder do 20% more damage. Changes Arceus's and Judgment's type to Dark.

name: Iron-plate
effect: Held: Steel-Type moves from holder do 20% more damage. Changes Arceus's and Judgment's type to Steel.

name: Odd-incense
effect: Held: Psychic-Type moves from holder do 20% more damage. Breeding: Mr. Mime begets a Mime Jr. Egg.

name: Rock-incense
effect: Held: Rock-Type moves from holder do 20% more damage. Breeding: Sudowoodo begets a Bonsly Egg.

name: Full-incense
effect: Held: Holder moves last in its priority bracket. Breeding: Snorlax begets a Munchlax Egg.

name: Wave-incense
effect: Held: Water-Type moves from holder do 20% more damage. Breeding: Mantine begets a Mantyke Egg.

name: Rose-incense
effect: Held: Grass-Type moves from holder do 20% more damage. Breeding: Roselia or Roserade beget a Budew Egg.

name: Luck-incense
effect: Held: Doubles the money earned from a battle. Does not stack with Amulet Coin. Breeding: Chansey and Blissey beget a Happiny Egg.

name: Pure-incense
effect: Prevents wild encounters of level lower than your party's lead Pokémon. Breeding: Chimecho begets a Chingling Egg.

name: Protector
effect: Traded on a Rhydon: Holder evolves into Rhyperior.

name: Electirizer
effect: Traded on an Electabuzz: Holder evolves into Electivire.

name: Magmarizer
effect: Traded on a Magmar: Holder evolves into Magmortar.

name: Dubious-disc
effect: Traded on a Porygon2: Holder evolves into Porygon-Z.

name: Reaper-cloth
effect: Traded on a Dusclops: Holder evolves into Dusknoir.

name: Razor-claw
effect: Held: Raises the holder's critical hit ratio by one stage. Held by a Sneasel while levelling up at night: Holder evolves into Weavile.

name: Razor-fang
effect: Held: Damaging moves gain a 10% chance to make their target flinch. Held by a Gligar while levelling up: Holder evolves into Gliscor.

name: Explorer-kit
effect: Allows visiting the Underground.

name: Loot-sack
effect: Carries coal mine loot.

name: Rule-book
effect: List of battle types and their rules.

name: Poke-radar
effect: Use to track down rare or shiny Pokémon. 50 steps to recharge.

name: Point-card
effect: Keeps count of Battle Points earned.

name: Journal
effect: Records prior significant activities the player took.

name: Seal-case
effect: Stores Seals that can be applied to Poké Ball capsules.

name: Fashion-case
effect: Holds Pokémon Accessories for use in Contests.

name: Seal-bag
effect: Holds ten Seals for Poké Balls.

name: Pal-pad
effect: Use to record Friend Codes and check your own.

name: Works-key
effect: Grants access to Valley Windworks.

name: Old-charm
effect: Trade to Cynthia's grandmother in Celestic Town for HM04 (Surf).

name: Galactic-key
effect: Grants access to Galactic HQ in Veilstone City.

name: Red-chain
effect: Used to bind Palkia and Dialga.

name: Town-map
effect: Use to see the overworld map.

name: Vs-seeker
effect: Allows rebattling of on-screen trainers. 100 steps to recharge.

name: Coin-case
effect: Holds coins for the Game Corner.

name: Old-rod
effect: Used to catch Pokémon in bodies of water.

name: Good-rod
effect: Used to catch Pokémon in bodies of water.

name: Super-rod
effect: Used to catch Pokémon in bodies of water.

name: Sprayduck
effect: Used to water berries.

name: Poffin-case
effect: Holds Poffins.

name: Bicycle
effect: Use for fast transit.

name: Suite-key
effect: Opens a locked building in the Lakeside Resort.

name: Oaks-letter
effect: Allows access to Seabreak path, Flower Paradise, and Shaymin.

name: Lunar-wing
effect: Cures sailor's son of nightmares in Canalave City.

name: Member-card
effect: Allows access to Newmoon Island and Darkrai.

name: Azure-flute
effect: Allows entry into the Hall of Origin. Unreleased.

name: Ss-ticket
effect: Ticket for a ship. (RSE: S.S. Tidal LF: S.S. Anne HG: S.S. Aqua)

name: Contest-pass
effect: Allows participation in Pokémon Contests.

name: Magma-stone
effect: Magma is sealed inside.

name: Parcel
effect: Given to the trainer's rival in Jubilife City. Contains Town Maps.

name: Coupon-1
effect: The first of three tickets used to obtain a Pokétch.

name: Coupon-2
effect: The second of three tickets used to obtain a Pokétch.

name: Coupon-3
effect: The last of three tickets used to obtain a Pokétch.

name: Storage-key
effect: Grants access to the Team Galactic warehouse in Veilstone City.

name: Secret-potion
effect: Used to heal the Ampharos at the top of Olivine Lighthouse.

name: Griseous-orb
effect: Boosts the damage from Giratina's Dragon-type and Ghost-type moves by 20%, and transforms it into Origin Forme.

name: Vs-recorder
effect: Records wireless, Wi-Fi, or Battle Frontier battles, and stores points.

name: Gracidea
effect: Changes an unfrozen Shaymin to Sky Forme in the day.

name: Secret-key
effect: Gen IV: The key to Rotom's appliance room. Gen III: The key to Cinnabar Gym.

name: Apricorn-box
effect: Holds Apricorns.

name: Berry-pots
effect: Allows portable berry growing.

name: Squirt-bottle
effect: Use on Sudowoodo blocking the path on Route 36. Also waters berries.

name: Lure-ball
effect: 3× effectiveness while fishing. Made from Blu Apricorn.

name: Level-ball
effect: Success rate based off of fraction target Pokémon is of user's Pokémon. Made from Red Apricorn.

name: Moon-ball
effect: 4× effectiveness on familes of Pokémon with a Moon Stone evolution. Made from Ylw Apricorn.

name: Heavy-ball
effect: Has flat bonus or penalty to catch rate depending on weight class of target. Made from Blk Apricorn.

name: Fast-ball
effect: 4× effectiveness on Pokémon with 100 or greater base speed. (Gen II: Roaming or Fleeing Pokémon). Made from Wht Apricorn.

name: Friend-ball
effect: Caught Pokémon start with 200 happiness. Made from Grn Apricorn.

name: Love-ball
effect: 8× effectiveness on opposite sex, same species targets of the Active Pokémon. Made from Pnk Apricorn.

name: Park-ball
effect: Catches Pokémon in the Pal Park every time.

name: Sport-ball
effect: Tries to catch a Pokémon in the Bug-Catching contest in National Park. (Gen II: Park Ball)

name: Red-apricorn
effect: Used to make a Level Ball.

name: Blue-apricorn
effect: Used to make a Lure Ball.

name: Yellow-apricorn
effect: Used to make a Moon Ball.

name: Green-apricorn
effect: Used to make a Friend Ball.

name: Pink-apricorn
effect: Used to make a Love Ball.

name: White-apricorn
effect: Used to make a Fast Ball.

name: Black-apricorn
effect: Used to make a Heavy Ball.

name: Dowsing-machine
effect: Use to find hidden items on the field. AKA Itemfinder.

name: Rage-candy-bar
effect: HS: Traded for TM64. Gen II & Gen V: Acts as a Potion.

name: Red-orb
effect: Summons Groudon to the Embedded Tower.

name: Blue-orb
effect: Summons Kyogre to the Embedded Tower.

name: Jade-orb
effect: Summons Rayquaza to the Embedded Tower.

name: Enigma-stone
effect: S: Summons Latias H: Summons Latios.

name: Unown-report
effect: Keeps track of Unown types caught.

name: Blue-card
effect: Keeps track of points from Buena's show.

name: Slowpoke-tail
effect: A tasty tail that sells for a high price.

name: Clear-bell
effect: HS: Allows Kimono-girls to summon Ho-oh. C: Summons Suicune to the Tin Tower.

name: Card-key
effect: HS: Opens doors in the Radio Tower. Gen III: Unlocks Silph Co Doors.

name: Basement-key
effect: HS: Key to the tunnel under Goldenrod City. Gen III: Key to New Mauville.

name: Red-scale
effect: Trade to Mr. Pokémon for an Exp. Share.

name: Lost-item
effect: A Poké Doll lost by the Copycat who lives in Saffron City. Trade for a Pass.

name: Pass
effect: Grants access to ride the Magnet Train between Goldenrod City and Saffron City.

name: Machine-part
effect: Must be replaced in the Power Plant to power the Magnet Train.

name: Silver-wing
effect: Summons Lugia to the Whirl Islands.

name: Rainbow-wing
effect: Summons Ho-Oh at the top of the Bell Tower.

name: Mystery-egg
effect: Deliver to Professor Elm.

name: Gb-sounds
effect: Use to listen to GameBoy era audio.

name: Tidal-bell
effect: Allows Kimono-girls to summon Lugia.

name: Data-card-01
effect: Records the number of times the trainer has come in first place overall in the Pokéathlon.

name: Data-card-02
effect: Records the number of times the trainer has come in last place overall in the Pokéathlon.

name: Data-card-03
effect: Records the number of times the trainer's Pokémon have dashed in the Pokéathlon.

name: Data-card-04
effect: Records the number of times the trainer's Pokémon have jumped in the Pokéathlon.

name: Data-card-05
effect: Records the number of times the trainer has come in first in the Pokéathlon Hurdle Dash.

name: Data-card-06
effect: Records the number of times the trainer has come in first in the Pokéathlon Relay Run.

name: Data-card-07
effect: Records the number of times the trainer has come in first in the Pokéathlon Pennant Capture.

name: Data-card-08
effect: Records the number of times the trainer has come in first in the Pokéathlon Block Smash.

name: Data-card-09
effect: Records the number of times the trainer has come in first in the Pokéathlon Disc Catch.

name: Data-card-10
effect: Records the number of times the trainer has come in first in the Pokéathlon Snow Throw.

name: Data-card-11
effect: Records the number of points the trainer has earned in the Pokéathlon.

name: Data-card-12
effect: Records the number of times the trainer's Pokémon have messed up in the Pokéathlon.

name: Data-card-13
effect: Records the number of times the trainer's Pokémon have defeated themselves in the Pokéathlon.

name: Data-card-14
effect: Records the number of times the trainer's Pokémon have tackled in the Pokéathlon.

name: Data-card-15
effect: Records the number of times the trainer's Pokémon have fallen in the Pokéathlon.
